Intervention: Patients receive low doses of omega-3 PO BID and placebo PO BID supplementation for 6 weeks.
Analysis of laboratory biomarkers: related studies
Bras II (Omega-3 fatty acid at high dose)
Patients receive a high dose of omega-3 PO BID supplementation for 6 weeks.
Analysis of laboratory biomarkers: related studies
Eligibility: Have a confirmed diagnosis of breast cancer; participants may have had more than one diagnosis of primary cancer in the past
Have undergone a standard type or combination of adjuvant therapy (surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy) for breast cancer

· To have completed all forms of standard adjuvant therapy (surgery, chemotherapy, radiotherapy) for breast cancer between 4 and 36 months prior to study registration; participants can currently take hormones (such as tamoxifen) or monoclonal antibodies (such as Herceptin)

There must be cancer-related fatigue, as indicated by a response of 4 or more when asked to assess their level of fatigue at its worst in the last week on an 11-point scale anchored by "0" = no fatigue and "10" = as bad as you can imagine
Have used omega-3 marine supplements at any time in the previous 3 months (this includes omega-3 prescription drugs such as Lovaza®)
• Sensitivity or allergy to fish and/or molluscs
• Sensitivity or allergy to soya and/or soya
Have confirmed a diagnosis of chronic fatigue syndrome or other diagnosis known to cause severe fatigue
Results: Average change (6 weeks - baseline) and standard deviation in cancer-related fatigue, using the brief Fatigue Inventory - Abbreviated Form (BFI-SF) and the Multidimensional Fatigue Symptoms Inventory - Abbreviated Form (MFSI-SF). 81 Subjects had both a baseline value and a 6 week value
BFI-SF is a 4-point questionnaire to assess the severity of fatigue, ranging from 0 (no fatigue) to 10 (as bad as you can imagine).
The first four sub-scales (general, physical, emotional and mental) are summarized and the vigour scale is subtracted to create a total fatigue score of -32 (low fatigue) to 96 (low fatigue).
Arm/group title: arms I (low-dose omega-3 fatty acid)
Description arm/group: Patients receive a low dose of omega-3 PO BID and placebo PO BID supplementation for 6 weeks.
Analysis of laboratory biomarkers: related studies
Unit of measurement: units on a scale BFI-SF Average Post - Pre: -3.66 (-4.37 to -2.96)
Arm/group title: arms II (Omega-3 fatty acid at high dose)
Description arm/group: Patients receive a high dose of omega-3 PO BID fatty acid supplementation for 6 weeks.
Analysis of laboratory biomarkers: related studies
Unit of measure: units on a BFI-SF scale Average position - Pre: -3.68 (-4.31 to -3.05)
